attributes.additional_details:
To quote Brenda Hale, President of the Supreme Court.

"The effect upon the fundamentals of our democracy was extreme,”

Continuing...

“The court is bound to conclude, therefore, that the decision to advise Her Majesty to prorogue parliament was unlawful because it had the effect of frustrating or preventing the ability of parliament to carry out its constitutional functions without reasonable justification.”
attributes.background:
The UK Supreme Court has found that the PM Boris Johnson deliberately misled The Queen to prorogue Parliament during one of the most intense crises of modern times.

For a Prime Minister to deliberately subvert our democratically elected Parliament is unacceptable.

Boris Johnson must resign.

rejection.details:
The resignation of the Prime Minister would be an individual decision for that person, and not a decision for the Government or Parliament as a whole.

If you're concerned about a particular policy or decision that's the responsibility of Government or Parliament, you could start a petition about that.
